intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. versifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive bifurcated or split appearance. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and it is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides.
